videoTitle: HOW TO CREATE A VARIABLE GROUP ON AZURE DEVOPS
videoDescription:
Variables give you a convenient way to get key bits of data into various parts of the pipeline. The most common use of variables is to define a value that you can then use in your pipeline. All variables are stored as strings and are mutable. The value of a variable can change from run to run or job to job of your pipeline.

OUTLINE

00:00 Go to "Pipelines"
00:04 Click on "Library"
00:08 Click on "Variable Group"
00:14 Define the variable group name
00:28 Add the variables
00:58 Click on "Save"

#azure #devops #variable

videoTitle: How to Create Cron Jobs in Azure DevOps Pipelines  | Automate Your Workflow
videoDescription:
In this video, we'll explore how to schedule cron jobs in Azure DevOps Pipelines using YAML. Whether you're new to Azure DevOps or looking to enhance your CI/CD workflows, this step-by-step guide will help you automate tasks with ease.

**What You'll Learn:**

- Mastering Azure DevOps: Schedule Cron Jobs with YAML
- Step-by-Step Guide to Cron Jobs in Azure DevOps Pipelines
- Enhance Your CI/CD: Setting Up Cron Jobs in Azure DevOps
- Automate Tasks in Azure DevOps Pipelines with Cron Jobs
- How to Get the Required Cron Job Syntax

**Why Watch This Video?**

By the end of this tutorial, you'll understand how to define cron jobs in your Azure DevOps pipelines, ensuring your workflows are efficient and automated. Cron jobs are essential for running scheduled tasks, such as backups, updates, and custom scripts, at specified intervals.

**Key Takeaways:**

- Understanding cron jobs and their importance in automation.
- Setting up your Azure DevOps project for pipeline creation.
- Creating a new pipeline and defining cron jobs in YAML.
- Writing the correct cron job syntax for various scheduling needs.
- Monitoring and managing your cron jobs within Azure DevOps.

**Don't forget to:**

- Like this video if you find it helpful.
- Subscribe to Techtonic Shift for more DevOps tutorials.
- Hit the bell icon to get notified of our latest uploads.
- Leave a comment if you have any questions or suggestions for future videos.

videoTitle: How to Integrate ServiceNow and Azure DevOps in a 2-Way Sync
videoDescription:

Find out more about this integration: https://unito.io/integrations/servicenow-azure-devops/?utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=video&utm_campaign=sn_ado_demo

In this video, we demonstrate:

Setting up a flow between ServiceNow and Azure DevOps using Unito
Customizing field mappings and sync directions

videoTitle: How to Migrate TFS to Azure DevOps
videoDescription:
OpsHub Migrator for Microsoft Azure DevOps (OM4ADO) is an enterprise-grade Azure DevOps migration tool developed in partnership with Microsoft. Designed for seamless, no disruption migration, OM4ADO effortlessly transfers work items, test entities, projects and more between all Azure DevOps combinations with no downtime.

OM4ADO allows you to move data across organizations and collections, and customize the migration process to meet your needs. The delta sync feature ensures a smooth cutover by allowing for incremental updates and synchronization between source and target systems. This eliminates the need for source system downtime, as you can continue using it while the target system is validated. 

Watch how OM4ADO can move projects between the source and the target in this TFS to Azure DevOps (VSTS) migration in five simple steps.

To learn more, click: https://www.opshub.com/products/opshub-azure-devops-migrator/

videoTitle: DevOps vs Platform Engineering: Platform Engineering replaced DevOps
videoDescription:
Is Platform Engineering Replacing DevOps? | DevOps vs Platform Engineering Explained

In today’s video, I dive deep into the evolving landscape of DevOps and Platform Engineering, two concepts shaping the future of modern software development. With years of hands-on experience in DevOps, I bring you a unique perspective, exploring their differences, similarities, and why Platform Engineering isn’t replacing DevOps, but rather enhancing it.

👉In This Video, You'll Discover:

⬇️What is DevOps?
Learn the fundamental principles of DevOps and how it bridges the gap between development and operations teams to improve collaboration and efficiency.

⬇️What is Platform Engineering?
Explore how Platform Engineering aims to create a seamless developer experience by building an Internal Developer Platform (IDP), standardizing tools, and optimizing workflows to support scalable application delivery.

⬇️DevOps vs Platform Engineering:
Is Platform Engineering replacing DevOps? I unpack why Platform Engineering complements DevOps by streamlining processes and reducing inefficiencies, without overshadowing the core values of DevOps.

➡️Why You Should Care:
As software development practices evolve, so do the needs of teams. While DevOps has been foundational in creating faster, reliable, and scalable software, Platform Engineering is becoming the backbone that allows organizations to scale those processes. IDPs, automation, and standardization help reduce redundant work and enable developers to focus on high-value tasks. The result? Better software, faster.

↪️Key Takeaways:
👉DevOps is a cultural shift, aiming for collaboration and agility between development and operations teams.

👉Platform Engineering builds infrastructure to empower developers, treating the platform as a product with IDPs that facilitate smoother deployments and continuous delivery.

👉Both practices are vital. Platform Engineering enhances DevOps by providing tools and processes that improve scalability and efficiency.

✅Join the Discussion!
Have you worked with Platform Engineering or DevOps? Share your experiences and thoughts in the comments below! Do you agree with my take on the relationship between these two practices? Let’s discuss!

videoTitle: 📈🎓Mastering the DevOps Engineer Road Map🌟🔧 | #thillaithetechie
videoDescription:
✅ Foundational Knowledge: Understand Linux, scripting (Python/Bash), and networking basics.

✅ Version Control: Master Git for source code management and collaboration.

✅ CI/CD Pipelines: Learn Jenkins, Travis CI, or CircleCI to automate testing and deployments.

✅ Configuration Management: Gain expertise in Ansible, Puppet, or Chef for infrastructure as code.

✅ Containers and Orchestration: Dive into Docker and Kubernetes for efficient application deployment.

✅ Cloud Platforms: Get hands-on experience with AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud for scalable solutions.

✅ Monitoring and Logging: Implement tools like Prometheus, Grafana, and ELK stack for system monitoring.

videoTitle: Django Simple Deploy and other DevOps Things - Talk Python to Me Ep. 500
videoDescription:
We’re sitting down with Eric Matthes, the educator, author, and developer behind Django Simple Deploy. If you’ve ever struggled with taking that final step of getting your Django app onto a live server (without spending days wrestling with DevOps complexities), then give Django Simple Deploy a look. Eric shares how Django Simple Deploy automates away the boilerplate parts of deployment, so you can focus on building features instead of deciphering endless configs. We’ll talk about this new project’s journey to 1.0, the range of hosting platforms it supports, and why it’s not just for beginners.

videoTitle: The ULTIMATE DevOps Roadmap For Beginners | How to become a DevOps Engineer in 2024!
videoDescription:
Here's my DevOps roadmap for beginners, the same skills that I gained to get my first DevOps role in 2019.

1. Linux & The Terminal
2. Bash Scripting
3. Docker Containers
4. Python
5. Networking
6. Terraform
7. AWS or Azure
8. Jenkins (CI/CD)
9. Ansible

videoDescription:
Join Our Exclusive AWS DevOps Mentorship Program 🚀 👇

----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Welcome to our comprehensive guide on becoming a Cloud/DevOps Engineer! In this video, we'll take you through the key skills you need to excel in this field, along with timestamps for easy navigation.

00:00 - Introduction:
Get an overview of the exciting world of Cloud/DevOps Engineering and the skills you'll need to succeed.

0:18 - Skill 1: Learn Linux:
Master the fundamentals of Linux operating systems, including distributions, command-line tools, shell scripting, and system administration.

0:39 - Skill 2: Learn Git and GitHub:
Discover version control with Git and collaboration using GitHub. Create repositories, manage code versions, and collaborate effectively with other developers.

1:43 - Skill 3: Learn One Cloud Provider:
Choose a cloud platform, like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud, and dive deep into its services. We'll cover AWS, exploring services like EC2, S3, RDS, IAM, Lambda, CloudFormation, and CloudWatch.

2:22 - Skill 4: Learn the Fundamentals of Python:
Acquire a strong foundation in Python programming, a crucial language for scripting, automation, and building AWS-related tools and solutions.

3:03 - Skill 5: Learn Terraform (IaC):
Explore Infrastructure as Code (IaC) with Terraform. Learn how to provision and manage infrastructure resources efficiently, with code.

3:30 - Skill 6: Learn Docker and Kubernetes:
Delve into containerization with Docker and container orchestration with Kubernetes. Ensure seamless deployment and scaling of applications across various environments.

3:40 - Skill 7: Learn How to Build CI/CD Pipelines:
Understand Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) practices. Create pipelines for building, testing, and deploying applications efficiently and reliably.

3:54 - Skill 8: Learn Ansible:
Master Ansible, a powerful configuration management and automation tool. Write Ansible playbooks to automate infrastructure provisioning and application deployments.

4:27 - Where to Learn and Develop These Skills:
Discover valuable resources and platforms where you can enhance your Cloud/DevOps skills and become a sought-after professional.

Embark on your journey to becoming a skilled Cloud/DevOps Engineer by following this step-by-step guide. Each skill covered in this video is essential for success in this dynamic and rapidly evolving field. Don't forget to like and subscribe to stay updated with more insightful content. Happy learning!

🔍 What You'll Learn:
Source Control Integration: Utilize GitHub Actions for version control and automation.

Model Training & Testing: Set up environments and automate linting and unit testing.
CI/CD Pipelines: Deploy models using GitHub Actions and Azure Machine Learning CLI (v2).
Automation & Monitoring: Implement continuous integration and delivery for seamless updates.​
Microsoft Learn

This tutorial is ideal for data scientists and machine learning engineers looking to streamline their workflows and adopt industry best practices in MLOps.​

In this full End-to-End MLOps tutorial, we walk you through building an automated CI/CD pipeline for Azure ML model training and deployment using Azure DevOps. Whether you're a beginner or an 
expert, this guide will help you streamline machine learning workflows and automate deployment!

videoTitle: Cracking the DevOps Code: Courses & Certifications for Success
videoDescription:
Take the courses mentioned here, get certifications and do not forget to add these using our AI-Powered Resume Builder (https://pro.kudoswall.com)
Certifications for Employed DevOps Professionals:
AWS Certified DevOps Engineer: This certification from Amazon Web Services (AWS) validates your expertise in deploying, operating, and managing applications on the AWS platform.
Azure DevOps Engineer: Offered by Microsoft, this certification demonstrates your skills in designing and implementing DevOps practices using Azure technologies.
Google Cloud Professional DevOps Engineer: This certification focuses on designing, developing, and managing DevOps practices on the Google Cloud Platform.
Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA): Certified by the Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF), CKA validates your Kubernetes skills, which are crucial for container orchestration.
Certified Jenkins Engineer: Offered by CloudBees, this certification recognizes your proficiency in using Jenkins for continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines.
Red Hat Certified Engineer in DevOps: This certification from Red Hat validates your skills in using Red Hat technologies for automating, managing, and optimizing DevOps processes.

Courses for Aspiring DevOps Engineers:
Introduction to DevOps Practices: Online platforms like Coursera, edX, and Udemy offer various introductory courses that cover the fundamental concepts and practices of DevOps.
Docker and Kubernetes Courses: Understanding containerization and orchestration tools like Docker and Kubernetes is essential. There are numerous courses available for beginners and advanced users.
Cloud Platform Courses (AWS, Azure, GCP): Learning the basics of cloud platforms and their DevOps-related services is crucial. Many platforms offer free and paid courses for beginners.
CI/CD Pipeline Courses: Courses on continuous integration and continuous delivery tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, and CircleCI are essential for automating software delivery.
Infrastructure as Code (IaC) Courses: Learning tools like Terraform and Ansible for automating infrastructure deployment is key for DevOps engineers.
Monitoring and Logging Courses: Understanding tools like Prometheus, Grafana, and ELK Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana) for monitoring and logging is vital.
Scripting and Programming Courses: Proficiency in scripting languages like Python and programming languages like Java can enhance your DevOps skills.
Security and Compliance Courses: DevOps engineers should also be well-versed in security practices. Courses on DevSecOps and security automation can be beneficial.
#DevOpsIndia #Certifications #Courses #TechSkills #CareerGrowth #Cloud #Automation

videoTitle: Matthew Skelton - DevOps Topologies 10 years on: what have we learned about silos, collaboration...
videoDescription:
In this talk, Matthew Skelton - CEO at Conflux and co-author of the book Team Topologies - explores the key learnings from 10 years of Team Topologies and State of DevOps Reports and outlines key steps that organizations can take to improve IT delivery performance:

Organize for flow
Address team cognitive load
Estimate the cost of “tangled software”
Use the Accelerate metrics and community techniques to find good boundaries for flow
Develop secure foundations in social and technical practices that support fast flow
Take a realistic view about the nature and scale of change needed
By combining learnings from State of DevOps Reports and Team Topologies together with principles championed by the DevOps community, organizations can navigate a route to business agility via a fast flow operating model.

videoDescription:

videoTitle: The Difference Between DevOps Engineers, System Administrators, and IT Technicians (Desktop Support)
videoDescription:
After watching this video, you will find out who IT technicians, sysadmins, and system engineers are. Why is there so much hype around DevOps right now? How do engineers differ from administrators? And what highly specialized professions are system administrators divided into?

Timestamps:
0:00 Intro
1:07 IT technicians a.k.a. Desktop Support Engineers & Administrators
2:49 System Engineers & Administrators
4:38 Network Engineers & Administrators
6:07 Information Security Specialists a.k.a. Cyber Security Engineers
7:13 DevOps Engineers
9:27 Things To Remember

IT technicians (also known as Desktop Support Engineers) in most organizations are responsible for laptops, PBXs, printers, scanners, etc.

System engineers are responsible for complex IT systems design, and administrators work with the existing systems. Both are more about networks, servers, and other complex hardware.

In large organizations, the aspects of system administration are often divided into narrow specializations: networks, web administration, information security.

DevOps engineers are indispensable persons in companies with development teams and continuous integration (online games, streaming platforms, large retailers, and other services with an audience of thousands). They are responsible for smooth development, testing, and deployment.

------------------------------------

videoDescription:
How to Transition from Application Development to DevOps Engineering: My Journey & Tips

In this video, I share my personal journey from being a software engineer to becoming a DevOps engineer. If you're considering a career in DevOps but don’t know where to start, this video is for you! I break down the essential steps, concepts, and tools that helped me make the transition.

⬇️Key Takeaways from the Video:
✅The difference between software development and DevOps engineering
✅Understanding the software development lifecycle and deployment process
✅The importance of Continuous Integration (CI) and automation in DevOps
✅Key responsibilities of a DevOps engineer or platform team
✅Tips on continuously learning and growing in the DevOps field

Starting a career in DevOps can seem overwhelming because of the wide range of tools and technologies involved. However, with the right mindset and understanding of core principles, you can overcome the challenge. Remember, learning is a constant journey, and every day is an opportunity to improve and grow in your career.

I’ll explain how to break down DevOps into manageable concepts and how to get started, even if you're new to the field. Don’t worry if you're not familiar with all the tools used in DevOps; the key is to understand the fundamental concepts that will help you adapt to any environment.

videoTitle: Azure DevOps Migration Tool for VSTS Migration
videoDescription:
OpsHub Migrator for Microsoft Azure DevOps (OM4ADO), previously known as OADOM and OVSMU, is an enterprise–grade Azure DevOps migration tool designed for zero downtime and no disruption Azure DevOps migration. OM4ADO simplifies consolidation efforts across various Azure DevOps organizations, eliminating challenges such as high maintenance costs, reduced productivity, and insufficient reporting. It seamlessly migrates work items, test entities and more enhancing business agility.   

Developed in collaboration with Microsoft, OM4ADO helps in comprehensive transfer of data with full context within the Microsoft landscape whether it is a TFS to Azure DevOps (VSTS) migration or an Azure DevOps to Azure DevOps migration or any other combination of the two instances.   

OM4ADO also allows you to efficiently transfer data between organizations and collections. The delta sync feature enables incremental updates and data sync between source and target, eliminating source system downtime and allowing uninterrupted use of the source system during target system validation.  

Watch this video to learn how OM4ADO migrates data from VSTS to VSTS hassle-free!  

For more information on Azure DevOps Migrations with OM4ADO, visit: https://www.opshub.com/products/opshub-azure-devops-migrator/

In this episode, I sit down with Yevgeniy Brikman, co-founder of Gruntwork and author of “Terraform: Up & Running,” to discuss his upcoming book, “The Fundamentals of DevOps and Software Delivery.”

Yevgeniy Brikman’s Bio
Yevgeniy (Jim) Brikman loves programming, writing, speaking, traveling, and lifting heavy things. He does not love talking about himself in the 3rd person. He is the co-founder of Gruntwork, a company that offers products & services for setting up world-class DevOps Foundations. He’s also the author of three books published by O’Reilly Media: Fundamentals of DevOps and Software Delivery, Terraform: Up & Running, and Hello, Startup. videoTitle: What's the goal of Platform Engineering? #shorts #devops #platformengineering
videoDescription:
Watch the full video: https://youtu.be/JAblex0uS4k

What’s the goal of Platform Engineering? Platform Engineering focusses on the building the infrastructure and the systems that are needed for running your applications and supporting your application throughout the software life cycle. So,  the goal  is to support the developers in the organisation and treat them as customers. That’s why we have in platform engineering the concept of IDP Internal developer platform.
 
So, this platform is treated as an actual product and the customers of the product are the developers.
What is the role of the IDP?
It is to create a thin layer on top of the toolchain that is used inside the organisation to standardise the processes and help developers to have one way to deploy into production

videoTitle: What is Git? How would you define Git? || #GitHub #GitLab #BitBucket #DevOps #Git #Python #Java
videoDescription:
What is Git?

How would you define Git?

Well, Git is a distributed version control system, which means two things:

1. It's distributed so people around the world can share code
2. It does version control

So, with version control, you can take snapshots of the state of your current code and maintain a history.

Branching is really the third thing. Git branches allow developers to do isolated development and take chances without messing up the main branch.

So when someone asks me 'What is Git?', that is how I typically respond.

videoTitle: #Day5 of #100DaysOfDevOps: Essentials of Networking for DevOps
videoDescription:
#DevOps #NetworkingEssentials #LinuxCommands #OSIModel #CloudComputing #DevOpsSkills #TechFundamentals #NetworkingBasics #NetworkingForDevOps #DevOpsJourney #100daysofdevops 

🚀 Unlocking Networking Essentials for DevOps 🚀

In today’s video, we’re diving into one of the most crucial areas for any DevOps professional—Networking! 🌐 Understanding networking basics is key for managing cloud resources, troubleshooting connectivity, and ensuring smooth deployments.

In this video, we cover:

📚 Networking Basics & OSI Model
Explore the OSI Model and understand how each layer functions.

🛠️ Essential Linux Commands for Networking
Boost your efficiency in networking with must-know commands:

ifconfig/ip: View and manage network interfaces.
ping: Check connectivity to other hosts.
traceroute: Trace packet paths to their destinations.
netstat/ss: Inspect active connections and listening ports.
nslookup/dig: Retrieve DNS information.
curl/wget: Make HTTP requests and download files.
tcpdump: Capture and analyze network packets.
nc (Netcat): A versatile tool for reading and writing data across networks.
Mastering these commands and concepts will empower you to troubleshoot, configure, and optimize network settings like a pro.

Tune in to gain valuable insights and practical skills essential for any DevOps journey! 🚀

videoDescription:
In this series we will learn the concepts of DevOps from a perspective of developers. How can these concepts help us be better developers and managers in our day to day jobs. In a startup you might need to fill the shoes of a DevOps, in a big company you might need to communicate with a DevOps team that has wildly different ideas.

We will gain a different perspective and understanding of the entire process by leaving our comfort zone and focusing on the wider picture. We will learn about different disciplines such as platform engineering and so much more.

In the first installment we discuss version control. As developers, we see it as a tool to collaborate and save our code. To track our mistakes and changes. In this video we learn why it's a crucial nexus point with the DevOps team and how we can work better to enable that.

videoTitle: DevOps 90 Days Challenge | Day 6 | Linux Basics & Essential Commands for DevOps
videoDescription:
Welcome to Day 6 of the DevOps 90 Days Challenge!
In this video, we dive into Linux Basics and Essential Commands every aspiring DevOps Engineer must master in 2024. Whether you're a Linux beginner, a system admin, or just curious about Linux vs Windows, this tutorial is perfect for you!

What You’ll Learn:

Why Linux is the foundation of DevOps and cloud computing

Linux file system structure explained

Must-know Linux commands: cd, ls, pwd, chmod, ps, top, and more

File operations and content viewing

User & permission management (useradd, chown, chmod)

System & process monitoring (df, free, htop)

Networking commands (ifconfig, ping, ssh, scp, rsync)

Package managers: apt, yum, dnf, brew

Why Linux is Important in DevOps?
Most servers, containers, and open source tools run on Linux. Understanding it helps with automation, troubleshooting, and managing infrastructure efficiently.

videoTitle: Manage & Secure Kubernetes Cluster Policies via OPA Gatekeeper. #opa #devops #gatekeeper
videoDescription:
Manage & Secure Kubernetes Cluster Policies via OPA Gatekeeper. #opa #devops #gatekeepers 

Timestamps:

Theory/Concepts : 00:00
Hands on/Practical : 09:00

github repo : https://github.com/RohanRusta21/opa-gatekeeper.git

Concepts :

OPA Gatekeeper: Policy and Governance for Kubernetes

What is OPA:

The Open Policy Agent (OPA) is an open-source, general-purpose policy engine that unifies policy enforcement across the stack. OPA provides a high-level declarative language that lets us specify policies as code and simple APIs to offload policy decision-making from our software. We can use OPA to enforce policies in microservices, Kubernetes, CI/CD pipelines, API gateways, and more. 
In kubernetes, OPA uses admission controllers.

What is OPA Gatekeeper?

OPA Gatekeeper is a specialized project providing first-class integration between OPA and Kubernetes.
OPA Gatekeeper adds the following on top of plain OPA:
● An extensible, parameterized policy library.
● Native Kubernetes CRDs for instantiating the policy library (aka “constraints”).
● Native Kubernetes CRDs for extending the policy library (aka “constraint templates”).
● Audit functionality.

Why you need Gatekeeper?

As a Platform DevOps engineer managing multiple Kubernetes clusters for various projects, you face challenges when users deploy applications without adhering to best practices. Key issues include:
  1.     Lack of ownership unless users apply labels themselves.
  2.     No resource limits, leading to high costs.
  3.     Untrusted images impacting other applications.
  4.     Security and best practice violations across clusters.

To address these, we need governance to enforce limits and rules via policies. OPA Gatekeeper can be configured to implement these policies, ensuring best practices are followed.

A DevOps engineer serves as a pivotal link between development and operations teams, fostering seamless collaboration and communication to optimize the software delivery lifecycle.

videoTitle: 8 DevOps Best Practices You MUST KNOW in 2024 | Essential DevOps Best Practices 2024
videoDescription:
In this comprehensive video, we will cover various key aspects of DevOps best practices. We'll start with an insightful introduction, providing you with a solid foundation of understanding DevOps and its significance in the modern IT landscape. Then, we'll explore the criticality of cultural change and how it plays a pivotal role in fostering a collaborative and innovation-driven work environment.

Next, we'll dive into version control and trunk-based development, showcasing how these practices streamline code management and facilitate seamless collaboration among developers. Automation will also take center stage, as we discuss the benefits of automating repetitive tasks, enabling faster deployment and reducing manual errors.

Moving forward, we'll shed light on continuous integration and continuous delivery, two pivotal practices that ensure frequent code integration and deployment. Monitoring and feedback will be explored as well, emphasizing the vital role of real-time feedback loops and continuous monitoring in maintaining software quality and performance.

Moreover, we'll delve into the realm of DevSecOps, highlighting the importance of integrating security into every stage of the development process. Building secure applications is paramount in an age where cyber threats are constantly evolving.

We'll also touch upon the significance of identical and reproducible environments, discussing how environment consistency leads to smoother deployments and more reliable software. Lastly, we'll emphasize the significance of documentation, highlighting how well-documented procedures and code enable efficient collaboration and knowledge sharing.

Join us on this insightful journey as we unpack the essential DevOps best practices for 2023. Make sure to subscribe to our channel and hit the notification bell to stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in the world of DevOps!

The goal is for the audience to learn how their role in technology can drive positive environmental change, ensuring a greener future through thoughtful innovation and operations.

videoTitle: Practical DevOps: Continuous Delivery vs Continuous Deployment
videoDescription:
Continuous integration, deployment, and delivery are like vectors with the same direction but different magnitudes. Their goal is the same: to make our software development and release process faster and more robust.

The key difference between the three is in the scope of automation applied. What confuses people new to the field is that they are not mutually exclusive, but include each other, like Russian dolls.

6:24 Key takeaways
7:05 Conclusion

videoTitle: DevOps in Your Shopping Cart with Stephan Rupp, Pentland Firth WOC005 #devops #eshopping #automation
videoDescription:
Pentland Firth's smart shopping solution EASY Shopper is currently being deployed in the shopping carts of a major German supermarket chain. Right now, it’s been rolled out in Germany. And yay! We have Stephan Rupp from Pentland Firth as our guest.

Stephan, as the Team Lead for his operations team, describes to our host Christian Steinberger the exciting development journey from separate operations and development teams and manual server provisioning to a modern organization embracing automation.

From the start, Pentland Firth aimed to handle their solution with a small team, making Stephan and his team true pioneers in automation over the past eight years. Stephan discusses the challenges and successes they faced culturally, entrepreneurially, organizationally, and in sales. On the technical side, Stephan talks about their tool stack – from Ansible and Kubernetes to Terraform.

Stephan's conclusion: His team lives DevOps and has internalized the values and culture that DevOps demands from us.

Listen in! And hey, you know we’re thrilled about your subscriptions, comments, and likes

SHOWNOTES
Theory of Constraint: https://de.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theory_of_Constraints
"The Phoenix Project": https://itrevolution.com/product/the-phoenix-project/

🍪 Visit our website https://www.rossy-it.com/

channelDescription:
WALLS OF CONFUSION entstehen im IT-Alltag aufgrund unterschiedlicher Perspektiven von Software-Entwicklung (Dev) und IT-Betrieb (Ops). Der Ansatz DevOps löst die klassisch zutagetretenden Probleme in der Zusammenarbeit, strafft die Time-to-Market und enabelt unternehmerische Effizienz.

Herzlich willkommen auf der Ops-Seite der Wall of Confusion! Unser Job ist es, die Software von Entwicklerteams in einen einsatzfähigen Zustand zu bringen und somit ihren Erfolg zu sichern. Dafür bauen wir zum Beispiel Pipelines durch die Wall oder schaffen Verbindungen oder Automatismen hinüber zur Entwicklerseite. Unser aller Ziel sind cloud-native bzw. microservices-basierte Architekturen in modernen Multicloud-Umgebungen.

Hier erzählen wir euch vom Ops-Alltag, von der Zusammenarbeit mit Entwicklerteams, generell über unsere Branche, über Lösungen, über Organisation, über Menschen, Methoden und Tools. Abonniert unseren Kanal, aktiviert die Glocke und diskutiert mit uns.

videoTitle: Red Hat DevOps Culture and Practices - the secret sauce
videoDescription:
Red Hat Training: DevOps Culture and Practice Enablement (TL500) is a five-day, immersive class offering students an opportunity to experience and implement cultural shifts that are utilized in many successful DevOps adoption journeys. Many agile training offerings focus on a particular framework, delivery mechanism, or technology. Instead, DevOps Culture & Practice combines the best tools from many leading frameworks to blend continuous discovery and continuous delivery with cultural and technical practices into a unique, highly-engaging experience simulating real-world scenarios and applications.

For more information, visit red.ht/DevOpsCulturePractices

videoTitle: Honing a DevOps Edge | Perforce’s Vision and Roadmap  2025
videoDescription: Never before have the promises and perils of enterprise innovation been so great. An entire class of innovation built on AI creates enormous potential for delighting customers, igniting productivity and launching new offerings. channelDescription:
Bring Order to Innovation with Perforce Software Version Management

Whether you're building an enterprise application, a killer game, a ground-breaking mobile device or the next social media platform, choosing the right software version management is a must.

Perforce enables teams to work together on important files like software code, documents, spreadsheets, images, and other digital assets. Our products take the conflict out of collaboration by making it easy to find the right files, work on them in parallel, and store them securely.

Perforce offers free educational and open source licenses for organizations that meet the criteria.

videoTitle: DevOps at Scale | GitKon 2022 | Andrew Pankevicius, Atlassian
videoDescription:
DevOps at Scale: What it Really Looks Like to Scale Your Product Org from 1 to 100 People

DevOps at scale can be tricky, especially if you’re growing your team. Get best practices from Andrew Pankevicius, senior product manager for Jira DevOps at Atlassian. 

As organizations scale, teams quickly learn that it’s not just about hiring. It’s also about how your team’s tools and internal development practices pivot, scale and grow to meet the increasing needs of your organization. 

Andrew Pankevicius, senior product manager for Jira DevOps at Atlassian, walks through the critical milestones of growth, from DevSecOps as a foundational concept on day one, to cross-functional release orchestration and managing your DevOps toolchain while scaling your development team.

#devopsatscale #devops #gitkon #gitkraken #jira #jiradevops

videoTitle: Stop using Read-Host and do this instead #powershell  #devops  #scripting
videoDescription:
Stop using Read-Host and do this instead:

Read-Host has limitations. 

- You cannot pass information to it 
- You cannot validate what the user provided
- It always stops the script

There is a better way - use parameters instead.

- Control the type of input
- Make it mandatory or optional
- Pass argument from the command line
- or prompt the user to provide an argument, when required and not passed

In this short video, I'll show you how to implement simple parameters and how to use them.

Would you like to learn more about the parameters?

videoDescription:

Don't forget to like, share, and subscribe! Hit the bell icon to stay updated with our latest videos.

For Interview related training please feel free to reach us over the call 9845421738 to discuss further.

I am gonna tell you what DevOps engineers do in less than a minute with an example.

In a restaurant kitchen, there are chefs and wait staff.

Chefs are responsible for creating and experimenting with new dishes. Their job includes coming up with innovative recipes, testing them, and adding the successful ones to the menu. At the same time, they also prepare food to meet the regular demand of customers who visit the restaurant daily. This dual responsibility of innovation and ongoing service can become overwhelming, especially during busy hours when the kitchen is already at full capacity.

Wait staff, on the other hand, focus on delivering the prepared food to customers. Their primary role is to ensure that the food reaches the diners promptly and in perfect condition, keeping the restaurant’s operations running smoothly.

Experimenting with a new dish during peak hours, however, becomes a significant challenge. The process of testing new recipes while maintaining the flow of regular orders often leads to disruptions in the kitchen, causing delays and dissatisfaction among customers.

To address this, the restaurant hires a kitchen manager. The kitchen manager creates a separate small kitchen dedicated to experimenting with new dishes. This ensures that the chefs can focus on their innovations without interfering with the ongoing operations. Once a dish is perfected, the kitchen manager introduces automation, such as using a conveyor belt, to streamline the cooking process. This allows the new dish to be produced efficiently alongside the existing menu items while ensuring there are no interruptions in serving food to the restaurant's customers.

Yes, DevOps engineers are none other than automation experts.

videoTitle: The VSM Renaissance: Catalysed by DevOps | Helen Beal
videoDescription:
#DevOps has enabled digital transformation. In fifteen years, the way we engineer software has revolutionized. It’s spread Continuous Integration and delivery across the globe, humanized IT culture, automated toil, and paying down technical debt. But it’s nowhere near done. A lot of organizations have hit the ceiling. A wall. The brakes. Stagnated. The promise remains: We can thrive in the digital age, create joy through customer experiences, move fast, be nimble, outcompete, and achieve extraordinary organizational performance. But it needs unlocking. #ValueStreamManagement has hundreds of years of history, but its time is now. Building on everything we’ve learned from DevOps, using the toolchains, pipelines, and rich data sources we’ve created, combining VSM and DevOps means we can see organizations as value-generating enterprises. We can pinpoint the choke points, bottlenecks, and dependencies and quickly apply fixes to optimize flow and value realization.

In this talk, Helen Beal will share real stories from enterprises she’s worked with on how they’ve relentlessly pursued improvement using VSM and DevOps practices and the outcomes they’ve seen.

----

About the speaker:

Helen Beal is CEO and Chair of the Value Stream Management Consortium and co-chair of the OASIS Value Stream Management Interoperability Technical Committee. She leads the ambassador program at PeopleCert for the DevOps Institute, ITIL, and PRINCE2. She is also Chair of the DevNetwork DevOps Advisory Board and provides strategic advisory services to DevOps and VSM industry leaders.

Helen authorizes the VSMC's annual State of VSM Reports and Moogsoft's State of Availability Report. She is also a co-author of Investments Unlimited, a book about DevOps and governance published by IT Revolution. She is a DevOps editor for InfoQ and writes for many other online platforms.

Helen hosts the Day-to-Day DevOps webinar series for BrightTalk and speaks on DevOps, AI, and value stream-related topics at industry conferences and corporate events.

She regularly appears in TechBeacon’s DevOps Top100 lists, was recognized as the Top DevOps Evangelist 2020 in the DevOps Dozen awards, and was a finalist for Computing DevOps Excellence Awards’ DevOps Professional of the Year 2021.

She serves on advisory and judging boards for many initiatives, including Developer Week, DevOps World, JAX DevOps, and InterOp.

----

👇 Learn more:
https://www.thedevopsconference.com/copenhagen?utm_campaign=The%20DevOps%20Conference%20Scandinavia%202024&utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=social&utm_content=youtube_link_copenhagen_2024

If you want to learn more about DevOps transformations, check out our page here:
https://www.eficode.com/devops-transformation
----

videoTitle: Automating license enforcement in your CI/CD pipeline and trends in DevOps with Eli Birger
videoDescription:
Eli's talk at DevOpsDays Raleigh focused on automating license checks in CI/CD pipelines. Of course, the topic of open source licenses is fascinating to the All Things Open community and we wanted to learn more. During this interview, we talked with Eli about the importance of open source licensing, in particular, how they are automating license enforcement. Then we discussed some trends in DevOps from the perspective of a former DevOps engineer and manager.

Registration for All Things Open 2024 is now open. Register now to save your spot: https://allthingsopen.org/ato-registration-now-open

0:00 - Introduction
0:08 - Welcome Eli Birger
0:40 - Tell us about yourself
2:10 - Can you share a few key takeaways that you shared with the audience here? 
3:28 - Why are open source licenses important?
4:16 - What's happening in DevOps, a topic, a trend, a debate, that people should be aware of?
5:09 - What's one piece of advice that you want to share with the All Things Open community?

Key takeaways:
* We publicly share  the CI/CD enforcement we built for different types of licenses
* The topic of open source licenses is very complex and very boring
* The volume of licenses complicates the space
* Be aware of "blind spots" in your processes and methodology
* Do not take things for granted and challenge everything
* Invest at least one hour a day for learning and challenging things

###
About Eli Birger 
Eli is a passionate technologist with a background in telecom, cyber, and storage. He has over six years of experience as a DevOps Manager, where he specialized in building large-scale SaaS systems based on Kubernetes. As the CTO at PerfectScales, his current focus is on building solutions that solve the pains of operating highly-disturbed Kubernetes systems, keeping them running both efficiently and resiliently.

About All Things Open
All Things Open is a universe of open source events and platforms designed to educate and connect technologists around the world. It includes the All Things Open conference, the largest open source / tech / web event on the U.S. East Coast, meetups in the Research Triangle Park (RTP) of NC, South Carolina, and New York City, and a YouTube channel with more than 1,000 free recordings. See everything we do at https://allthingsopen.org.

Join our meetups:
* New York City meetup: https://www.meetup.com/Open-Source-NYC/
* South Carolina meetup: https://www.meetup.com/open-source-south-carolina/
* Research Triangle Park, NC meetup: https://www.meetup.com/all-things-open-rtp-meetup/

Follow All Things Open:
* YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/c/AllThingsOpen/videos
* LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/all-things-open
* Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/allthingsopen/
* Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/AllThingsOpen/
* Twitter: https://twitter.com/AllThingsOpen
channelDescription:
A universe of events and platforms focused on open source, open tech and the open web. #AllThingsOpen

All Things Open™ is a conference for developers, technologists and decision makers around the topic of open source in the enterprise. The event will feature world-class speakers, content and networking opportunities. Attendees can choose from 45 minute - 1.5 hour sessions or workshops hosted by some of the best open source experts in the world.

The goal is to educate you so you can make open source work for your company.

Conference location is the only place it could be, the Raleigh Convention Center in downtown Raleigh, NC, the open source city.

videoTitle: How to containerized an application hands-on demo for beginners | DevOps tools | Docker
videoDescription:
In this video, a web application has been containerized in three easy steps.
00:00 Hands-on objective
01:07 What is Container in (Software industry)
01:55 Advantages of Containerization
02:50 Prerequisite
04:11 Dockerfile
04:59 docker hub registry
05:47 Creation of docker image
07:55 docker images command
08:10 Creation of docker container
09:55 docker ps command
10:15 hit the URL in a web browser
10:55 Containerized application
11:06 CTA

Containers Demo:
Hosting a simple static content using nginx web server (origin server)

Prerequisite: docker client must be installed on an EC2 instance
Steps:
Step 1: Create a docker image using a Dockerfile
docker build -t  *image-name* .

step 2: Create a container 
docker run --name *container-name* -d -p 8080:80 *image-name*

Step 3: Hit http://localhost:8080 or http://host-ip:8080 in your browser.

videoDescription:

In recent years, how we approach development has dramatically changed with the rise of DevOps, Cloud Computing, and Container technologies. Many stakeholders at our organizations are ecstatic about Shift Left, DevSecOps and VSM, but how are we as Java developers embracing this new cultural shift? In this session we explore the most common Critical Challenges to Adopt DevOps Culture in Software Organizations, best practices and some excellent news with success stories. #Java #DevOps #DevOpsForJavaDevelopers #DevOps #TheDEVOPSConference

videoTitle: Master Cloud Computing Autoscaling: Save Money and Boost Performance! #devops #cloud #autoscaling
videoDescription:
Autoscaling is a game-changer in cloud computing, allowing you to dynamically adjust computational resources based on the load on your server farm. This means you can automatically increase or decrease the number of servers running behind your web application, optimizing for both performance and cost efficiency. 💡

In this video, I explore how autoscaling works, its benefits, and why it's essential for modern cloud infrastructure. Learn how to handle sudden traffic spikes without wasting resources, ensuring your applications run smoothly and cost-effectively. Don't miss out on mastering this vital cloud-computing technique!

videoTitle: AIVP - Automatizar pruebas de un centro de control #shorts #testing #devops #software #cicd
videoDescription:
Video original: https://youtu.be/jgjNDJfGzxg

Esta herramienta permitía la creación de pruebas automáticas a varios niveles. Desde levantar las aplicaciones hasta automatizar las acciones manuales que haría un operador de satélites. Estas pruebas se las conoce como end2end y son las más complicadas debido a que involucran muchas partes del software con sus posibles ramificaciones. Estas pruebas y este framework está muy orientado al dominio en concreto, y, por tanto, las pruebas eran muy específicas, Y dependía de muchos factores como podría ser no solo el modelo sino el satélite en concreto debido a su configuración. Con lo cual para cada 1 había que hacer una batería de pruebas en concreto para poder probar por ejemplo valores concretos de parámetros de telemetría.

videoTitle: Accelerate DevOps Artifact Delivery of Docker images, NPM & Debian packages with Varnish
videoDescription:
Modern organizations rely on external dependencies for software development, testing, and delivery. Fast artifact delivery is critical to DevOps workflows—any delay can slow deployments and impact developer productivity.

But by offloading CI/CD system pressure and positioning caches closer to developers, you can reduce network latency, minimize wait times, and improve overall efficiency. 

In this webinar, we’ll demonstrate how to accelerate DevOps artifact delivery by caching key assets like Docker images, Debian packages, and NPM libraries using Varnish Enterprise, a leading caching and data acceleration platform.

Join us for a hands-on session featuring real-world examples across various artifact management platforms, demonstrating how Varnish optimizes artifact delivery and enhances Quality of Service in diverse DevOps environments.

00:00 Intro
00:44 Why cache package repositories?
02:27 Demo layout
02:53 Setting up a demo environment in AWS
06:05 Demo: caching Debian packages with Varnish
10:41 Demo: caching NPM packages with Varnish
17:00 Demo: caching Go modules with Varnish
21:07 Concepts of caching private Docker images with authentication
22:25 The VCL code to cache private Docker images in Varnish
23:50 Demo: caching private Docker images in Varnish with authentication
27:02 Outro

videoTitle: Emmanuel Ahaiwe - Balancing Technical Debt and Modernisation in DevOps
videoDescription:
This talk explains a balanced approach for a successful migration. A thorough understanding of the quirks of legacy applications is the foundation for a successful migration to more modern infrastructure in DevOps. However, this understanding cuts across various teams, not just the DevOps or SRE team. The security team has to perform a risk assessment, observability has to be in place by the SRE team, infrastructure compatibility, incremental migration strategy, Quality Assurance team needs to perform tests, and Documentation also has to be taken into account. Stakeholders - internal and external ones need to be carried along to manage expectations.

The approach of working across various teams ensures that all aspects of the migration process are addressed comprehensively, minimising risks and maximising the chances of success. Each team brings its expertise and perspective to the table, contributing to a well-rounded migration strategy. By involving all relevant teams and stakeholders from the outset, potential issues can be identified and addressed early on, leading to a smoother and more efficient migration process.

videoTitle: How does Shoreline help the individual DevOps engineer
videoDescription:
At Shoreline, we are creating GPT-powered runbooks to alleviate some of the challenges that come with being on call.

Being on call is like becoming an expert on everything that might go wrong, which is impossible. 

That's why our runbooks cover a wide range of scenarios to help engineers deal with:
- not just the pressure of fixing something quickly and correctly
- but also make sense of the vast, increasingly complex environments we deal with. 

We're at around 140 runbooks now, and we’re working with our customers to create more.

We aim to reach 1,000 in the next 12 months.

Our goal is to provide structured, accurate resources that offer insights into potential issues and a solid launching point on how to diagnose and repair them. 

By doing so, we hope to make engineers' lives a little bit easier and stress-free. 

Website: https://shoreline.io

videoTitle: App Connect Enterprise integration with Azure DevOps
videoDescription:
The continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipeline are best practice for DevOps teams. CI/CD, aims to streamline and accelerate the software development lifecycle.

Here the Build and Deployment Pipelines are created in the Azure DevOps.

Whether the code is initially deployed or re-deployment of codebase such as the webservice project is performed, then the Build and Deployment pipelines are triggered and the below mentioned configured tests/validations are performed and the code is promoted to the higher environment.

The below testing types are covered such as 
  1. Unit Testing
  2. Integration Testing (API/Webservices Testing)
  3. System Testing  (User Interface Testing/ Acceptance Testing)
  4. Performance Testing (Non-Functional Testing )

In an enterprise, there are heterogenous applications are present across the landscape, such as C, Java, Python, and Jscript etc., applications with various backend database such as Oracle, MysQL, Sql Server, DB2 etc., here the data communication is versatile, and volume is huge, which are handled by Enterprise Service Bus applications such as IBM App Connect Enterprise, hence development, testing and operation plays a vital role is organizational business success.

videoTitle: Evolving teams beyond DevOps | Johan Abildskov | Uber
videoDescription:
At The Future of Software conference in London, Johan Abildskov covered some of the troubles that come from the disconnect between how we perceive making software and what reality shows us, emphasizing concrete examples and practices.

In his talk, Johan highlights various topics that all software development teams should be aware of, including playfulness as a mindset and psychological safety vs. high performance.

----

About the speaker:

Johan is a Software Engineer at Uber. Johan helps build Odin, the stateful orchestration platform - part of the infrastructure that helps Uber serve more than 1M trips per hour every day. Before becoming a Software Engineer, Johan spent a few years as a DevOps and Continuous Delivery consultant, gathering experience across the industry.

----

videoTitle: Service Mesh vs. Data Mesh Explained #devops #microservices #servicemesh #datamesh #techtalk
videoDescription:
The journey from traditional monolithic architectures to microservices has brought unparalleled flexibility and innovation. But it also introduced a new layer of complexity. This is where service meshes shine by providing the backbone for secure, efficient, and observable inter-service communication.
Meanwhile, data meshes revolutionize data ownership and governance by ensuring each data product is managed with care and precision.

🎥 Watch the complete video here: https://youtu.be/5L2ceX5XrhY

videoTitle: DevOpsDays Seattle 2022: Continuous Improvement: DevOps and Mental Health by Aaron Aldrich
videoDescription:
Dealing with any neuro-diversity is difficult and stigmatized, but lessons learned from DevOps and Complex Systems management have helped me improve how I handle situations. These lessons can be applied broadly and shift our thinking to how DevOps extends beyond tech alone. Mental illness is stigmatized and hard to talk about publicly. Doubly so in the tech industry where we assign much of our personal value to our brains. I want to share my struggles with mental health and the lessons I’ve learned from Systems operation and DevOps that have helped me get by and frame my struggle in a manageable way.

I want to start a conversation to:

    Help reduce the stigma of Mental Illness by talking about it
    Provide some illustration of things that have helped me, so hopefully they can help you
    Show how the concepts of DevOps have application reaching beyond High Technology
    Spark further conversation about Mental health in tech
    Hopefully provide a new group and community for those for whom mental health is a concern

videoTitle: Jack Mead - How To Train Great DevOps Engineers? Apply DevOps Principles!
videoDescription:
Too often, developing our skills and careers is left as a side-effect as we chase the latest requirements of our current project. If we want our colleagues, and ourselves, to continue to promote DevOps principles and work in an ever-changing technical landscape, we need to make future-proofing our people a priority just like our applications.

Having helped over 100 learners develop their knowledge across the DevOps ecosystem and earn professional qualifications, I’ll share some insight into what we learned about unlocking more flexibility and more capability from each other by applying DevOps principles to the act of training, including how you can:

Take your user-focus & apply it to training goals
Be Agile with people’s careers
Apply principles of targeted monitoring to training

videoTitle: Process Optimization & Comprehension in DevOps. With Michael Bannach (umwerk) WOC006 #devops #cloud
videoDescription:
In episode WOC006 of Wall of Confusion, our guest Michael Bannach (CTO at umwerk) and host Christian Steinberger discuss efficiency in DevOps collaboration: How can developers and operators tackle the issues of the Wall of Confusion and lead our joint customer projects to success?

Michael suggests that comprehension – both the extreme complexity on both sides of the "wall" and interoperability – along with agreements, defined roles, and meaningful, lean, fluid processes are key. Communication, knowledge transfer, continuous checks, and the evolution of core processes, as well as standardization and documentation, are crucial components for him.

Tune in! We absolutely appreciate your subscriptions, comments, and likes. 🤩

🍪 Visit us on our website https://www.rossy-it.com/
🔊 Follow us on Linkedin: /rossy-it

#processoptimization #server #servers #aws #multicloud #kubernetes #terraform #interoperability #change
channelDescription:
WALLS OF CONFUSION entstehen im IT-Alltag aufgrund unterschiedlicher Perspektiven von Software-Entwicklung (Dev) und IT-Betrieb (Ops). Der Ansatz DevOps löst die klassisch zutagetretenden Probleme in der Zusammenarbeit, strafft die Time-to-Market und enabelt unternehmerische Effizienz.

Herzlich willkommen auf der Ops-Seite der Wall of Confusion! Unser Job ist es, die Software von Entwicklerteams in einen einsatzfähigen Zustand zu bringen und somit ihren Erfolg zu sichern. Dafür bauen wir zum Beispiel Pipelines durch die Wall oder schaffen Verbindungen oder Automatismen hinüber zur Entwicklerseite. Unser aller Ziel sind cloud-native bzw. microservices-basierte Architekturen in modernen Multicloud-Umgebungen.

Hier erzählen wir euch vom Ops-Alltag, von der Zusammenarbeit mit Entwicklerteams, generell über unsere Branche, über Lösungen, über Organisation, über Menschen, Methoden und Tools. Abonniert unseren Kanal, aktiviert die Glocke und diskutiert mit uns.

videoTitle: The History of Software Deployment & the Emergence of Serverless #cloudcomputing #devops #awslambda
videoDescription:
To understand the concept of serverless a little more clearly, let’s step back a little and have a look at the evolution of software deployment approaches: First, we have the bare-metal phase, then virtual machine, then container, then serverless.

In each of the first three paradigms, there is a concept of “where” your application is running: on a physical server onsite, on a VM, or on a cloud host or a container.

The modern age of serverless computing has taken the “where” out of our concerns about software deployment. 🎥 Watch the complete video on Serverless here: https://youtu.be/rA1b-9G1dXw

videoTitle: Azure DevOps & SpiraTeam: Boost Productivity & Quality - Complete Tutorial & Walkthrough
videoDescription:
This comprehensive tutorial and walkthrough demonstrates how to seamlessly integrate Microsoft Azure DevOps with Inflectra Spira (SpiraTest, SpiraTeam, or SpiraPlan). Discover how this powerful integration boosts productivity and streamlines your entire software development lifecycle (SDLC). ⭐️

Key Moments:

• 0:01:14 Introduction to Work Item Synchronization & Creating User Stories
• 0:03:09 Integrating Source Code & CI/CD Pipelines
• 0:06:21 Creating & Executing Test Cases in Spira
• 0:09:03 Logging and Synchronizing Defects (Spira to Azure DevOps)
• 0:11:18 Automated Test Results via Azure Pipelines in Spira
• 0:13:43 Bidirectional Defect Updates & Collaboration

We'll guide you through the process of setting up and utilizing this integration, highlighting bidirectional synchronization for key work items:

• Requirements/User Stories: Learn how user stories flow from Azure DevOps into Spira.
• Tasks: See how tasks are synchronized for efficient project management.
• Incidents/Defects: Understand the full lifecycle of defects, from logging in Spira to appearing in Azure DevOps, complete with detailed test results and comments.

The video also covers integrating your source code repositories (like Azure Repos) and CI/CD pipelines (e.g., Azure Pipelines) to provide full traceability from code commits and automated test results directly within Spira. We'll show you how automated tests (using frameworks like JUnit, NUnit, Selenium, Playwright) can automatically update test statuses in Spira.

Benefits of this Integration:

• Enhanced Traceability: Link requirements, test cases, defects, and source code for a complete picture 🔗.
• Improved Collaboration: Enable development teams in Azure DevOps and QA/BA teams in Spira to work hand-in-glove 🤝.
• Streamlined Workflows: Automate the flow of critical information, reducing manual effort and errors ⚙️.
• Faster Feedback Loops: Get immediate updates on defect status and test results across platforms ⚡.

Whether you're looking to achieve seamless development, optimize your testing process, or simply boost overall team productivity, this tutorial provides a complete walkthrough of integrating Azure DevOps and Spira.
